content: <metadata>   <idinfo>     <citation>       <citeinfo>         <origin>City and County of Denver, Community Planning and Development</origin>         <pubdate>20120613</pubdate>         <title>BUILDING OUTLINES</title>         <edition>3rd edition of building footprints</edition>         <geoform>vector digital data</geoform>       </citeinfo>     </citation>     <descript>       <abstract>Polygonal feature collection of all permanent structures and buildings captured and classified photogrammetrically for a 152 square mile area in the City and County of Denver with a 1/4 mile buffer, Glendale, and 28 1/16 section tiles in Littleton. The 2008 update (second edition) added new and reconstruction building outlines. The revision also includes structures and buildings in the Denver International Airport (DIA) area. These data were updated again in 2012 to bring them current as of the 2010 aerials and including all new buildings digitized by Public Works Wastewater Management (PWWMD). Originally, the buildings were digitized if greater than 100 square feet in size, however, the udpates included smaller buildings, such as sheds.</abstract>       <purpose>To show outlines of structures and buildings within the City and County of Denver.</purpose>       <supplinf>*NOTE: This layer is a work in progress. It is not final and the CPD_USE has not been checked.</supplinf>     </descript>     <status>       <update>As needed</update>     </status>     <spdom>       <bounding>         <westbc>-105.115206</westbc>         <eastbc>-104.599535</eastbc>         <northbc>39.909003</northbc>         <southbc>39.607843</southbc>       </bounding>     </spdom>     <keywords>       <theme>         <themekt>ISO 19115 Topic Categories</themekt>         <themekey>structure</themekey>         <themekey>location</themekey>       </theme>       <place>         <placekt>None</placekt>         <placekey>Denver</placekey>         <placekey>Denver County</placekey>         <placekey>Colorado</placekey>         <placekey>USA</placekey>       </place>     </keywords>     <accconst>None</accconst>     <useconst>ACCESS CONSTRAINTS:  None. The GlobalID field is necessary for maintaining object uniqueness across replicas. All feature classes and tables participating in one-way or two-way replication must contain the GlobalID field.
